intro: Codonorchis tetraphylla, commonly known as the four-leaf twayblade, is a terrestrial orchid native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. It has a rhizomatous root system and produces sporadic blooms, often in late spring or early summer. Codonorchis tetraphylla is known for its limited distribution and is considered a rare species in many regions.
